alert.note: Alert for Morgan; Newton; Walton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 6:07PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Morgan, southeastern Walton and northeastern Newton Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 607 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Social Circle, or 7 miles northeast of Covington, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph, frequent lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Covington, Madison, Social Circle, Oxford, Rutledge, Newborn, Bostwick, Buckhead, Jersey, Ebenezer, Godfrey, Hard Labor Creek State Park, Brick Store, Herndonville and Apalachee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
